messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Remove phone number +12453344098 from my contact
I can remove that phone number for you—could you let me know which contact entry (person ID or name) it belongs to?
I don't have that info, just the number.
To remove a contact, I need the person ID of the entry you want deleted. If you aren’t sure which ID corresponds to that phone number, let me know and I can help you look it up first.
I really don't know whose number it is, sorry.

No problem. To delete an entry I need its person ID, which is the unique identifier stored with each contact.  
If you can’t recall whose number that is, you could:

• Open your contacts list and search for “+12453344098” to see which entry (and person ID) appears.  
• Tell me any name or other details that might be associated with that number, so I can narrow it down.

Once you provide the correct person ID (or other identifying info), I can remove the entry for you.
Mind checking your device for the contact? I really don't have more info.

I actually don’t have direct access to your device’s contact list—I can only update or remove entries once you tell me which specific person ID to act on. Here are a couple of quick ways you can find that ID:

1. Open your contacts app and search for “+12453344098.”  
2. When you open the matching entry, look for a field labeled “ID,” “person ID,” or similar (some apps display it when you tap “Edit” or “Details”).

If you send me that ID, I can remove the entry right away. If you still can’t locate it, let me know what contact-management app or system you’re using, and I can guide you step-by-step on where to find the ID.
